Function Documentation

Gan_ImageTile* gan_image_tile_alloc ( Gan_ImageFormat  format,
Gan_Type  type,
unsigned long  height,
unsigned long  width 
)

Macro: Allocate and return a new image tile.

Allocates and returns a new image tile with given format (e.g. GAN_GREY_LEVEL_IMAGE, GAN_RGB_COLOUR_IMAGE), type (e.g. GAN_UCHAR for unsigned character images, GAN_DOUBLE for floating point images), height and width.

The image pointer is set through a call to gan_image_alloc()

See also:
gan_image_tile_alloc_image(), gan_image_tile_alloc_data() and gan_image_tile_free.

Gan_ImageTile* gan_image_tile_alloc_data ( Gan_ImageFormat  format,
Gan_Type  type,
unsigned long  height,
unsigned long  width,
void *  pix_data,
size_t  pix_data_size,
void *  row_data,
size_t  row_data_size 
)

Macro: Allocate image tile.

Allocates and returns an image tile with given format, type, dimensions height and width. If the provided pix_data and/or row_data pointers are NULL (in any combination), the pixel data array and/or the row start pointer array are dynamically allocated. If either are not NULL they must be big enough to hold the pixel/row pointer array data. If necessary use gan_image_data_size() to compute the necessary size of the pix_data array (the necessary size of row_data is height pointers).

If you want to dynamically allocate the pixel data array and/or the row pointer array with sizes greater than that necessary for the given height and width, pass pix_data and/or row_data as NULL and set pix_data_size and/or row_data_size appropriately.

The image pointer is set through a call to gan_image_alloc_data()

See also:
gan_image_tile_alloc(), gan_image_tile_alloc_image(), and gan_image_tile_free.

Gan_ImageTile* gan_image_tile_alloc_image ( Gan_Image *  image  ) 

Macro: Allocate and return a new image tile.

Allocates and returns a new image tile from an existing Gam_Image pointer.

The existing image is wrapped by a tile image structure, which does not take ownership of it

See also:
gan_image_tile_alloc(), gan_image_tile_alloc_data(), and gan_image_tile_free.

void gan_image_tile_free ( Gan_ImageTile *  tile  ) 

Macro: Free an image.

Free the memory associated with the image tile img.

The image pointer is freed through a call to gan_image_free()

Gan_TiledImage* gan_tiled_image_alloc ( Gan_ImageFormat  format,

unsigned long  height,
unsigned long  width,
unsigned int  tile_height,
unsigned int  tile_width,
Gan_ImageTile **  existing_tiles,
unsigned int  num_existing_tiles 
)

Form a new tiled image, optionally using a set of existing image tiles.

Returns:
A newly allocated tiled image
